item.title: Operators and Monitoring: making life easier for deployers
item.description:
In this article, I will share my thoughts, feedback and ideas following the work I have done on monitoring operands for the SF Operator, in the hopes that other developers looking to add deep insights and automated service tuning to their own operators may build upon my experience.

If you …
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Huin

item.title: Hacking Zuul for developers - Running unit tests
item.description:
Note

This article was updated on Dec. 11, 2023 to change the suggested version of the Ubuntu VM.

This article is a followup on my previous post about playing around with Zuul's source code . Here I will explain how to set up an environment where you can run Zuul's unit …
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Huin

item.title: Zuul Hands on - part 6 - Cross project dependencies
item.description:
In this article, we will explain how project dependencies work in Zuul.

This article is part of the Zuul hands-on series.

The examples and commands that follow are intended to be run on a Software Factory sandbox where a demo-repo repository exists. You should have such an environment after following …
item.dc:creator: Zoltan Caplovi

item.title: Delegating maintenance actions with Zuul - part 2
item.description: Zuul's CLI Client provides several actions that can help debugging kinks along its integration pipelines. These actions were until now only available to operators of a Zuul deployment, meaning that project members were dependent on the availability of an operator to help them sort problems out. I have been working …
